text: One of my favorite video game villains ever, and one of the reasons I love the Monster spin-off series so much. I'd put in the work to get him in my team just so I could take him along on my journey, then "upgrade" him to his true form during late/post-game. ^^
author: CTSael

text: Funny thing... I know this is a two-year old comment, but in "Final Fantasy Brave Exvius" there was a collab with the Dragon Quest series, featuring famous monsters from the series as units.... the Dragonlord is one of them, and a 5 Star-7 Star to boot!

author: Koopsas

text:
I have to admit, as an europian i never expierenced a dragon quest game... till i bought VIII. I havent beaten it yet though i have to say im very impressed by the soundtrack. The music is dramatic as a final fantasy battle theme.. but in a different , more classic way. Like music from very old - pre-70s movie.

This final boss theme is absolutely brilliant. I look forward to fight the final boss of VIII because i didnt hear a single note from it yet and wonder how koichi is going to amaze me.

text: It's probably also because this series is, for me, the best at giving you a sense of adventure. Finally reaching the final boss is always satisfying.

text: There's something really unique and tense about final bosses in this series, in part thanks to Sugiyama's compositions. I remember actually being scared to fight the final bosses since they're usually very challenging (unless you grind a lot).

text:
The one and only, Dragon Quest. Sure it looks and sounds primitive now, but what a classic this game is. The JRPG that started it all.

I have very fond memories of this game, I grinded like crazy as a kid.
